{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.07455v1", "title": "Explicit Morphisms in the Galois-Tukey Category", "summary": "If the Continuum Hypothesis is false, it implies the existence of
cardinalities between the integers and the real numbers. In studying these
"cardinal characteristics of the continuum", it was discovered that many of the
associated inequalities can be interpreted as morphisms within the
"Galois-Tukey" category. This thesis aims to reformulate traditional direct
proofs of cardinal characteristic inequalities by making the underlying
morphisms explicit. New, purely categorical results are also discussed.", "main_category": "math.LO", "categories": "math.LO", "published": "2025-04-10T05:00:16Z"}
